column2: muddpuppy79, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was so afraid when I started reading reviews on this med. However, I was desperate and decided to try it. I started with 1 a day for a week; 2 a day for a week, and eventually 3 to avoid full blown side effects. I noticed within 2 weeks a difference with bladder symptoms being better. I do and still do have stomach upset, but better than bladder feeling like it's on fire! This med gave me 95% of my life back. (some ppl take it out the capsule and swallow the powder). They say it helps avoid stomach upset. I did not see a real difference. Hope it works for you, sorry for those it does not. Been taking since August 2010.

column9: Like so many others, my life was pure hell and it took 3 months before IC was discovered.On Elmiron for 6 months @ 2 pills/day AM & PM.I was originally on 4 pills and may have to go up to 3 because some symptoms have returned since I went down to 2.  My biggest concern now is I just started seeing blood in my stools and I will call my Uro/Gyn in the A.M.  Has anyone else hadthis symptom??

column2: Glenn, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug for about 10 years. I suffered with Interstial Cystitis for three years because I was misdiagnosed with prostatitis. I was on antibiotics and pain meds for three years and felt helpless. I knew I could not go on living like that. My PC suggested a new Urologist. The new doctor performed a cystocopy and found my bladder wall was fully inflamed. He started out with bladder cocktail instillations and that helped but when he put me on four Elmiron per day I was amazed. It took about 3 months for it to start working but once it did my pain was gone. I must stay away from acidic foods and drinks. Tight fitting pants on my waist can cause a problem. It is very expensive but thank God for Elmiron!!

column2: joan, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: medication is causing migrain headachs, upset stomach, and acid reflex

column2: BarbieA, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Without this medication I would be not able to function.  It has reduced the number of times daily and nightly I  have to go to the bathroom. I am  able to function as if I do not have IC, although I still feel some pressure, but not pain.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had uti's most of my life. In 2010 I was diagnosed with Intersitial Cystitis (I.C.). I was afraid to start Elmiron because the side effects I read about. I was desperate for relief after 6 months of severe flares and pain associated with I.C. So I started off with 1 a day and each week added 1 pill until I was at the recommended dose of 3 a day. I feel this medication gave me my life back. I can eat a larger variety including Spinach Alfredo Pizza :) The only down side I've noticed is I have headaches and upset stomach most of the time. It is not enough to keep me from taking the Elmiron though. I would recommend Elmiron to anyone with I.C. Just start off slow like I did so maybe your body gets used to the med.

column2: AmandaCave, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Elmiron for a year now.  Before taking this medication my interstitial cystitis was unbearable.  Now with Elmiron i NEVER have bladder pressure anymore and I can go hours with out having to urinate (which used to be unheard of for me)

column2: Taterbug49, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Elimon for several years now but have been told by my pharmacy that the manufactor of it will no longer be making the drug. Is there any other medication for interstitial cysitiis?

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: i have interstitial cystitis and have been on elmiron since 1996 and it helps tremendously, with other rxs.  i know it works well, because a few years ago, i didn't refill the rx, for some reason.  within a short time the i.c. Pain went THROUGH THE ROOF !!!  After taking Elmiron again, the i.c. Pain, after a time went away again.  Please, keep up with Awareness, of I.C. any and all research and rxs including PAIN MEDICATION, that help those of us horribly affected by this vicious bladder disease !!!

column2: Tori Marie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Takes a while to work. I have intersistial cystis, UCLA IS USING IT IN THEIR RESEARCHDEPT.

column2: rcrfn24, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had bladder problems from a early age and I was finally diagnosed with IC. I have taken other meds when they prescribed Elmiron it has been the greatest I also take Prelief OTC and I am able to drink low acid coffee. I do recommend this drug I had to stop taking for a couple of weeks I was miserable.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was taking elmiron for about 4 months the first time I took it , and it worked great. All my life I have had UTI's ,kidney stones, and horrible bladder pain. I had surgery and they saw my bladder was inflamed. My urologist sent me to a different urologist. He is a specialist for IC. I found out i was pregnant and stopped taking it. I had severe pain immediately. Then had to start taking it again. If you have IC and become pregnant try to stay on elmiron if at all possible. I had a miscarriage at about three and a half months. After that I continued to take it. But it has not had the same effect as last time. It's like all my symptoms came back worse.If at all possible do not stop taking it if you can. A break in the routine can take months to correct. I also take a med. called Urelle it helps when you have a lot of burning pain.I have been diagnosed with IC for a year . I still have problems remembering to not rush to the doctor with a UTI for antibiotics. The flare ups feel just like an infection. I had a cyscostopy done and they found scar tissue inside my bladder it is very painful. I didn't know how common that was for others with IC.

column2: tyson, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Have been on Elmiron for 5 months and it has helped my pain but not the frequency. I have experienced enlarged and painful joints in my fingers.  Has anyone else had this problem?

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have taken this medicine for 15 years and it has been a God send.  I feel I can go on with my life.  I still have the Remso Treatments every 6 weeks but this medicine has helped so much with the daily pain.

column2: Joan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
dpark, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have suffered with bladder problems all my life so for the longest I just thought I had another bladder infection.  Then the pain started to get worse so I went to my ob/gyn & ended up having a hysterectomy.  That was a really hard recovey because I still hurt so bad.  My husband was getting really frustrated with me because I always complained about the pain.  It got to where I was having spasms and the pain was so bad I would ball up in the fetal position.  A new uroligist came in to town and as soon as I told him my symptoms, he knew, did a cystoscopy and the lining in my bladder looked terrible.  I started Elmiron and it took a good 4mos to get some relief, after 8mos much better and now a year and a half and I'm pain free.  I also have other auto-ammune disorders, hashimoto's thyroditis & fibramyalga. I would recommend Elmiron to anyone diagnosed with IC.

column2: MARIAT1978, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with IC after having it for almost 10 years.  I took Elmiron for 2 years, 3x a day.  I saw no improvement in 2 years.  It was a pain to take 1/2 hr before or after each meal and it did nothing for me.  I discontinued the drug and now suffer from severe bipolar depression.  Im not sure if it had anything to do with it but I did not suffer from any depression before.  Also, I had been throwin up alot recently and now I suffer from gastritis and possibly have celiac disease.  Its just a bad drug all around and causes so many side effects.

column2: crazyjudi, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Weight gain , hair loss

column2: GrammyJean, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had pelvic, bladder & vaginal pain for about 3 years. It began about a month after my Hystorectomy. Many different doctors didn't know why I was having so much pain and one told me " Your "exagerating" and there is no way you have that much pain". Of course I walked out of that office in a hurry. Finally I found a Urogynocologist who listened. I started treatment with the "Sling" with no help what so ever. In March I started on the Elmiron, I was sceptical because it could take up to 6 months to really work. BUT to my suprise in less than 2 months I started having much less urgency. still had the pain, frequency & leaks. He added Detrol La, that took away all but the Pain!  the first of June he added Amitriptaleen 25 mg. OMG!! The pain is nearly gone. Only when I'm on my feet many hours do I get discomfort!  These 3 drugs work together like a team along with a strict diet of no acid! I still have some pain with sex but its tolerable. I hope in time this too will lessen. Side effects: Tiredness, constipation & weight gain, all things I can live with as long as theres NO PAIN! WOO HOO!!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: My bladder condition is without symptoms due to this medicine.  Before the pain was constant with cystitis often and the pain and blood from my bladder that goes with it.

column2: deena551, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have taken this med for over 9 months and it has not helped my IC in the least.  I stopped taking it about 2 months ago and I have not noticed any change. when i was taking it there was no change, except more of my hair fell out, i developed IBS sypmtoms, and just got really depressed because it was suppose to work! I still have to use the bathroom around 35 times a day-im only 28!  i am so depressed it didnt work. i am now going into my doctor once a week to have meds placed directly into my bladder.  Maybe this med works for others, but for me it did nothing but negative things. and it was expensive and i have great insurance!  If you have IC with frequency-i never have much pain-but it just doesnt help.  heart breaking.

column2: determined mama, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken Elmiron to treat IC for over 5 years with satisfactory results. However, the hair loss, weight gain, additional bruising(combined with other meds), dry eyes and enhanced allergy response has me willing to take a vacation from Elmiron for a while and remain on the diet striclty to see if I can handle life without this medication. It may seem crazy but, I'll try and see what happens. Good luck to all who suffer with IC as I have.

column2: Rosie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have IC and I have been taking the Elmiron 2 tablets before bedtime and 2 tablets before I get up in the morning for 18 months. So far I do not feel any difference. I am starting with the Elmiron instillations and have some more hope since it goes directly to my bladder!

column2: justcarol, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug for nearly 10 years now. I suffered from Interstial Cystitis for years but was never diagnosed correctly. I had test after test and seemed to stay on antibiotics. I was on the verge of sucide due to the pain and helplessness I felt. I did not want to go on living like that. My PC finally told me about an OB/GYN who specialized in IC. I started out with bladder cocktail instillations and the helped but when he put me on Elmiron I was amazed. I took about 3 months for it to start working, but once it did, my pain was gone. Totally gone.  I am lucky because my Insurance covers this drug. I have been off of it for about a month now due to surgery and I am back to miserable now. I can start back again in 4 days and I will be so glad. I wish that all of my fellow IC sufferers could have the same results I have with Elmiron. It saved my life.

column2: lavy219, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking it for almost 2 years and it has helped so much!! It does cost alot, but if your income is low but you don't qualify for medicad than johnson and johnson can help with the cost, just go to the elmiron web site there is more details.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: me3, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This drug has given me back my life. I have been on Elmiron for approx. 3 years and could not be happier with this medication. I no longer have to go to the bathroom every 2-3 minutes. I really can not notice any side affects. My doctor told me this drug does not work for everyone, I am just so grateful that it works for me. Yes, the cost is high. I am lucky that my insurance covers it, but I would pay anything to be able to have a normal bladder.To me Elmiron is a miracle!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: RATINGS ONLY CAUSE I JUST STARTED IT. I WAS WONDERING A FEW THINGS. I JUST TUNRED 25 AND OTHER DRS THOUGHT I HAD ENDOMETRIOSIS BUT MY DR NOW TESTED ME FOR IC CAUSE IT WAS EASIER. THE TEST WAS POSITIVE..SO SAID. I THINK I HAVE ENDOMETRIOSIS MAYBE ON TOP OF THIS IC TOO. WELL WHEN I GET MORE INFO I WILL REPORT AND REVIEW AGIAN HOPE THE BEST FOR ALL

column2: Mom_on_Call, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was finally diagnosed with IC in 1997 and started Elmiron as soon as came on the market. It took 4 months to start working, but when it did the relief was unbelievable. I was finally able to go out without crying continuously. I'm still taking it 3 x a day and it's 2/2010. I also have Sjogren's Syndrome (which is related to IC) Fibromyalgia and DJD. Both are autoimmune diseases. I haven't had any real problems with the drug other than breakthrough pain at times and occasional UTI's. Unfortunately, at the moment I'm having excruciating pain that hasn't been diagnosed yet. I have had 5 UTI's since December 09, extremely unusual. Hopefully, it's not related to the Elmiron since I have been on it for 12 years. I haven't had any of the complications that the people have written about and I'm very sensitive to new drugs. Without the Elmiron I don't know what I would have done since DMSO caused extreme  pain and had to be removed immediately. I'm also very careful to never miss a dose. The thought of having to wait months for it to start working again is truly unacceptable.

column2: CarolynBrook, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: After numerous failed silver nitrate instillations, this drug, taken orally, was the key to helping my interstitial cystitis pain. I originally took 100mg 3x/day, but now I am down to 100mg 2x/day with no recurrance of bladder pain. I now can eat many more foods that used to upset my bladder, but always be careful and take small amounts of new foods to see how you do. If you have problems with hair loss, take BIOTIN supplements and those symptoms should subside.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Elmiron since August of this year.  I have noticed problems with dry eyes and have had to start taking Restasis for that problem.  I wish they would make a generic available for Elmiron because it is so expensive.  I have also added an over the counter product to my treatment of IC and it's called Prelief. Good luck to everyone out there in dealing with your IC.  Unless you have this problem, you can not understand the pain and life changes that come with this disease.

column2: mash, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Elmiron for about 10 years and I rarely experience bladder pain but still have urgency and frequency when I eat certain food or quit taking Elmiron for awhile(usually due to cost). I also have fibromyalgia and allergies and I was aware many other people have this problem but I didnt realize dry eyes and hair loss were also noted. I have also had dryer eyes and a small amount ofhair loss in the last couple of years. I do feel the side effects of taking Elmiron are better than not taking Elmiron and dealing with all the IC symptoms!

column2: susie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It helped me with my interstitial cystitis.Acupunture also helped.  As long as I takeit it seems to stay under control.

column2: Sherry, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had pain in bladder for years.  I went to one OBYGEN who did a bladder tack thinking this was my problem...but I continued to have pain I have had test for bladder cancer.  That was negative.  All of the doctors I went to said I had protein in my urine and treated it with antibiotics...finally I found a doctor who knew what test to do and this medicine is wonderful.  I only take two pills a day, (he prescribed three) but my insurance will not cover it since they see it as a pre-existing condition.  But with just the two pills a day I am still feeling 100% better.  The only side effect I have noticed is the easy bruising.

column2: llandolf, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Started Elmiron 5 months ago. Within 2 days if Felt like I never had IC. But a month ago the frquent , and painful urge to urinate returned. I am waiting to see my doctor to ask what I should do. I don;t understand why the pain and frequency came back I am still takem 3 pills a day.

column2: jas1963x, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Been on this med for 90+ days now for Interstitial Cystitis.   For several years now the doctor has given me antibiotics to combat prostatitis (urgency, frequency, dripping, forcing, false alarms, bladder pain) but it never worked.  After going through a cystoscopy IC was found.   I take 3 capsules in the morning and 3 capsules in the evening.   Tried to take 2 capsules 3x daily but it wasn't possible to work into a work schedule.   I noticed a decrease in my bladder pain with mild flare-ups once in a while if I don't watch the type of foods I eat (greasy, pickles, vinegar salad dressing).   It has greatly reduced the sense of urgency, not being able to hold it, and the pain.   The dripping still continues but at least I don't have that pain.  I did notice that if I take anything for headaches/pain such as Advil, Aleve, or Motrin my problems comes back.  I guess these OTC drugs inhibit the effect of Elmiron.  The only side effects I've noticed is an occasional skin irritation/scratching and some hair loss from an already receeding hairline.   I don't have another check-in with the doctor for another 90 days so we'll see where I'm at with continuing this or calling it quits.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: It has relieved the pain.

column2: Pearl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Elmiron for 2 years to help my I.C. symptoms. Started on 4 pills/day. After 1 year, I went off of it for a month and my symptoms returned. column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Took Elmiron for Interstitial Cystitus orally and have weaned myself taking this drug. column9: I have been on Elmiron for interstitial cystitis for over three years. My pain was so bad I could hardly walk. Also, have just been diagnosed with gastrointestinal ulcerations.  Has anyone else had this problem???  I am somewhat concerned this could be a side effect!!!????

column2: jesschap3, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i was diagnosed over three years ago with IC and was in so much pain but since taking this medication i feel so much better. It doesnt take away all the pain but it sure helps. My only complaint is how expensive it is and there's no generic but to live without the pain i'll do it.

column2: willow, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am a young woman with IC (I was diagnosed about a year ago). I've taken elmiron for the last 6 months and have had no success whatsoever with it. The side effects however have been quite prevalent. I've suffered constant nausea, nose bleeds, ect. Most recently my hair is falling out like crazy. I stopped taking it a few days ago as directed by my physician. I know it may work for some, but be aware of what else may occur while on elmiron.

column2: 35-44 Female  (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with IC in 2007 but have suffered from it for 14+ years. I have not yet tried this drug and am unsure of the side effects. I have been managing it through diet and so far so good. i would still like to get more testing done but I have no Ins so it will have to wait. I have started  my own ic support blog and will put it in my profile if I can so others can visit it anytime.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I am satisfied with the using elmiron however i'm not happy at all with the extreme hair loss i am experiencing.

column2: Lytha, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed w/ IC 5 years ago.  This is my second time taking Elmiron.  The first time it worked wonders, of course you must follow the diet as well.  After having my son, I started having major flare ups so I started on it again, hasn't worked as well this time have been on it for 5 months.  But I haven't been as strict w/ the diet either.  My advise to others w/ IC is don't give up,  it's hard to have a "normal" life, expecially sex, but it can be done. You need to have a lot of communication w/ your partner.

column2: maryanna, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Elmiron is the only approved drug on the market to treat I.C.  I have been on Elmiron for 6 months and while the pain has subsided the side effects have taken over, head-aches,blood in stool,run down feeling plus a few minor symptoms.   When I was  diagnosed with I.C. it was severe but I deal with the side effects and go on, I do not let it impede me life.  There is no other alternative. I choose to tolerate the side effects rather than the unbearable pain and damage I.C. can do to the bladder. Also, keep an open communication with your Dr. Call her/him and talk, come in and see her/him if you need a rescue treatment, for me they help and last longer than they did in the beginning. Support from your Dr.is important,for me it makes this condition much easier to deal with.  She is always there for me and in these times  that is rare but so very necessary.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I JUST STARTED TAKING THIS LAST MONTH. FEEL NO DIFFERENCE YET. A BIT DIZZY LATELY AND HEADACHES. A LITTLE BIT OF BREAKING OUT ON MY FACE AS WELL. FOR PAIN I HAVE TRIED THE ANTIHISTAMINES AND ANTI-ANXIETY BUT TO NO AVAIL. I AM ON ULTRAM NOW WHICH IS NON-NARCOTIC AND PROB. CAUSES SOME OF THE DIZZINESS. DOESN'T HELP WITH THE STINGING SENSATION. THE NURSE TOLD ME THAT THEY DON'T PRESCRIBE NARCOTICS FOR IC. FABULOUS. SO, I AM NOW DOING THE BLADDER COCKTAIL TREATMENTS. AM GOING TO MY SECOND ONE TODAY. HOPEFULLY SOMETHING WILL WORK SOON BC I FEEL LIKE I'M MISSING OUT ON MY LIFE. IT'S DEBILITATING. IT TOOK MONTHS BEFORE I WAS DIAGNOSED. THOUGHT I KEPT GETTING UTI'S. $4,000 WORTH OF TESTS LATER, I WAS DIAGNOSED.

column2: dtkcherry@yahoo.com, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I'm writing specifically to a mother who posted a ? about her 6 yr. old having IC. I've had it my entire life. My mom couldn't understand why an intelligent, advanced in motor skills 2 yr. old couldn't be potty trained. I was 5 before I understood that other people didn't feel like they had to pee all the time. God bless u for listening to your child. Please don't give up.

column2: indygal, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Although the drug works fairly quickly, I could only tolerate 2 days. Dizzy, headaches, nausea,absolutly sick.

column2: Deirdre, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have IC.  It's incurable.  Elmiron doesn't make it go away, but it makes it much better than without it.

column2: Sam, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It has helped me the symptoms of the side affects are not major but i can deal with them becase this medican is helping me

column2: acer, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: this medication has made my life so much more enjoyable... I don't hurt near as much unless I eat or drink something acidic... I am also on coumidin and dont have any bruising or bleeding....

column2: clint/lint, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It did not work for me, it made me get up at night to urinate 7 or 8 times.

column2: nicola, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was sick all the time.I felt moody,tired and mean.I also felt as if I was pregnant.I felt dizzy and nausea.I also had headaches.I was on 4oills daily.I tried takin g2 in the PM only but still woke up sick.I went down to 1 only no relief.I am looking for another med to treat the same symtom

column2: momellie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Have been on this 7 weeks, dificult to remember to take an hour before meals or 2 hours after meals,also notice discharge

column2: shar, 55-64 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This medication has made my life a whole lot better since I have been on it. The only time my bladder may hurt is when I overdue a food like too much acid as in tomotoes or red wine.  Other wise it has been a life saver. Only have bursing if I take Vitamin K or too much fish oil. I stay away from Vitamin K that will do me in on bursing. The only way K does not burse is when I take half the Multi Vitamin that has it. Better to not have it in the Vitamin. But that is hard to find it without it.

column2: taz0903, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Medication has kept me from having to use foley catheters which we all know how unomfortable they are. I have had no side effects and to be able to urinte is a wonderful thing.

column2: andrewsfunk@aol.com, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: For five years I suffered from debilitating pain from what my urologist initially thought was prostatitis. My consultation with the Cleveland Clinic was no help at all, and in fact exacerbated  my condition.Finally, after attending a seminar, my urologist prescribed Elmiron, and explained that it was a treatment of interstitial cystitis(IC). For me, it was a miracle drug. Within three days of beginning this therapy, my pain receded and I have been pain free for two years now. If you have been diagnosed with chronic prostatitis, Elmiron could resolve your symptoms. Mention Elmiron to your doctor who may be unaware that it sometimes works for men.

column2: fzwduck, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: i have been taking this medicine for one year. after going to my primary dr then a gi dr then finally my gyno made a correct diagnosis and referred my to a urologist it was almost two years of pain. now all pain with intercorse is gone. i still have the frequent urge to urinate but if i have to hold it i don't hurt as bad (i found drinking mostly water helps...i drink about 60-75oz a day! the urine is less acidic that way) i take this med two pills twice a day the second dose accompanied by elavil. i find this helps me sleep through the night. although i still have flare ups they last no longer than a week or two with several months of relief in between. i do loose hair on a regular basis but not enough to make me look bald. before if you just touched my stomach below my belly button i would freak out, same if my pants were too tight i just couldn't bear it but now i have no sensitivity to touch. one thing i havn't heard mentioned is that this is linked to allergies. my urologist says that over 90% of people who have this ic have allergies too. they beieve that this is a severe allergic reaction to something in your environment. has any one else heard this??? so in addition to the elmiron and the elavil i also take an allergy pill. the biggest downfall of this medicine is that it costs sooooo much and the manufacture does not offer much help. it was 130.00 on my dads prescription plan, on mine it is 67.00(who says wal-mart ins sucks?!) even though it is expensive its worth it and i am reminded of that every time i get a flare up. i do find that the only thing that i have to eliminate from my diet is caffene, spicy foods are fine in moderation other than that...no diet changes....

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: The pain has decreased for the most part, I still have breakouts and intercourse is still painful. The diarrhea is really bad.

column2: ellesse, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have interstitial cystitis.  Elmiron took many months before I saw benefit.  I have suffered with side effects of hair loss, very dry mouth and eyes, weight gain, and paresthesia along with a bad taste in my mouth.  I now take only about 2 pills per day.  The cost is very high and that is why I've taken my dose down.  I've taken it for 1 1/2 years.

column2: ann, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I began to experience a decrease in bladder pain after 2 months on Elmiron.  By the end of the 6 month treatment my doctor prescribed, I was virtually pain free.  Unfortunately, about a month after I stopped taking Elmiron, my pain came back. I am unsure as to why my doctor would not let me take it for a longer period of time.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
grandma, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: It cured the pain, decreased urinary frequency, but increased my weight. Although I have increased my physical activity and reduced calorie intake, cannot lose weight.

column2: 2ndchance, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed in 1999, I have been on it since then, and it has worked for me. I still get flares once in a while if I am not careful what I eat or drink.

column2: JO in california, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been suffering with bladder pain, spasms, burning for over 6 months, tested negative for IC doc started me on elmiron 2 months ago. I am very depressed, tired, moody have anxiety and a feeling of not being able to breathe well. Kind of a shortness of breath feeling.  Lots of headaches, dizziness. Doc says I should stay on the med for at least 6 months.  I sure do sympathize with all of you who have had to endure this miserable condition.  Any suggestions as to any other thing to make the pain go away??? Do any others suffer from anxiety and moodiness?

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This medication took several weeks to startworking, but it allowed me to be able towork again and to lead a more "normal" life.The pain isn't entirely gone and I do haveflare ups, but it has helped so much.  It is expensive but I have a good insurance which pays most of the cost.  I started out taking four a day, but after 2 years have been able to reduce to three a day and now2 a day, but if I have a flare-up I will goback to three a day dosing.   My main side effects have been severe hair loss, easybruising, and fatigue, but I can live withall of this to not have the severe bladderpain that I was experiencing before startingon this medication.

column2: IClady, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this and Ditropan XL for 6 years now for my IC.  It initially took about 3 months to start working and almost a year to get the full potential so i say stick with it for awhile if you can.  It is the only way i can work full time.  Diet is a huge part of it for me.  Avoid soda,coffee and beer for sure.  Vinager is pretty bad too.  For those of you having trouble with the cost, contact the manufacturer. When my job was cut last year and i was laid off they paid for an entire year supply.  Side effects got better over time.  Dry mouth and eyes for sure.  Drink water and carry around eye drops.  I also have fibromyalgia and IBS.  And so does my mom.  I swear it is all related to one main problem with the nerves in my body.  I am only 28  Does anyone else have these conditions along with the IC?

column2: KylieJoy76, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It took the doctors 3 years to diagnose my IC as they thought it was my Endometriosis. They put me on this and I made myself stay on it as I was soo excited to get some relief of pain and finally be healed! But, after 4 weeks on it I had to stop taking this medicine for several reasons. One, it made me nauseated, dizzy, moody and I just didn't feel like myself. I lost so much weight cause of the sickness I get from this my doc took me off of it until I gain some weight back, but I am not gonna take it again! The side effects are soo horrible and that is upsetting as I waited 3 years for them to figure out what was going on and have a diagnosis and now the medicine that is the only thing that heals the bladder wall makes me soo sick! Two, I have no insurance and this is almost 300 dollars a month where I live and I am also on Ditropan XL which is 100 dollars a month! I still take that because that is awesome for the pain!  I know the doc said Elmiron can take months to years before I see a difference, but the Ditropan XL helps the spasms of my bladder and I am soo grateful for Ditropan XL! If you can't take Elmiron and haven't been suggested Ditropan XL you should ask your doc for it! Elmiron and Ditropan XL together makes a faster recovery IF you can handle the horrible side effects!

column2: Meryle59@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The side effects of this drug were so intolerable that I was not able to take it for more than 5 days. I had horrible headaches, constant heartburn and diarhea and I had trouble sleeping at night from all of this.  I was taking the drug because I was recently diagnosed with IC.

column2: Bill, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with IC after a very long 1 year experience with the pain, problems voiding and overall horrid feeling all the time.  However, I am noticing that I am having eye problems (focus mostly).  Is anyone else having this problem.  I am on 2 capsules AM and PM.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had pelvic pain intermittently for years and finally was diagnosed with IC. Started on drug 4 months ago, taking two in morning and one a night. Some lessening of symptoms, no major side effects but I sure hope this works for me. It is very difficult for me to stay on the special diet and really do not know if it makes much of a difference in my case. Has anyone tried elavil in combination with this drug and had success? What other pain relievers have been helpful?

column2: Ginger Snap, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using Elmiron for 1 1/2 years.  It took time to start being effective (4 months) and now after all this time, I am in pain again.  Not as sever yet but for it to come back I am sure the full pain will return.  The doctors do not want to prescribe anything else for pain because this is suppose to take care of it.  What is wrong with doctors today?  We know our bodies better than anyone.  I am not a junkie, and don't even take asprin unless I really nead it.  Maybe I need to find a doctor who has had IC for awhile.  I would recommend Elmiron to everyone who has IC, however don't count on it forever.

column2: Dee, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It took two years before I found out that I had ICthanks to a great female doctor in the greater hartford area!!  I take one pill at 11:00 in the morning and two just  before I go to bed at night - still have some pain once in awhile but overall this med has  been great

column2: smokey1253, 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: my question is this....is this medication safe for an extended use on a child 6 yrs of age. I have talked with several urologists and was told a young child can not get IC...is this true?  if anyone has any pertinent info on this please post here for now.  thank you

column2: sjcreview, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This is my second round of Elmiron.  I stopped it when I became pregant and for several months therafter.  I had forgotten what relief it can bring from what was once very mysterious and terrible, side, back and upper quad pain.

column2: belize_bluehole@yahoo.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with IC in May 1999 (age 39). I have an excellent doctor (Susan McSherry. Mine was a full-blown case of IC, with severe pain, no response to any drugs or DMSO, the only relief were opiates, although, Elmiron was part of my treatment.  It was not effective at first, the drug didn't start working, until my pain and symptoms modified, which took about two years. Since then, and with regular doses of Elmiron, I have no more bladder pain or other symptoms. For the past seven years, I take only one 100mg, daily.  However, it is a very expensive drug, is a generic available, yet?

column2: birdlady7260,  Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: this completely relieves my symptoms of pelvic pain, frequency and inability to void. Unfortunately my insurance does not cover this med which is a real proble. How can we make them cover it?

column2: nanapam, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I biggest complaint is that I stay so tired and emotional since I started this drug. I was also put on allergy pills,flomax and two antiscotic drugs. My doctor explained that all these working together will most benifit my condition. IF, I take them all like subscribed, I stay so weak and dizzy, that I can not function in daily life. I need to lie down most of the day and feel so helpless. If anyone else is taking these made meds and are experncing these side effects, please email me at pamd53@verizon.comLet me know if these side effects will go away. I love to work in the veg. garden and flowers and have no energy to do either.

column2: LOVIEJOYCE, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: WHAT KIND OF FOOD THAT I.C PT CANT EAT

column2: Maggie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I began taking Elmiron 1 yr ago.At first, I was on a twice daily dose, but found that I was still in pain. After I switched to 3 times a day and noticed a big diffence. The drawback for me was that I lost some of my HAIR in the back and had to get a short haircut. Now it is growing out andno more hair loss since. It was hard to get used to taking it 1 hour before or 2-3 hours after a meal, but over time I found it easier. My eyes are sometimes dry too but I found drinking more liquids solved that problem. Although it is hard to have to take a pill three times a day, it really took away about 98% of the pain for me.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: After ten years of severe pelvic pain, I finally found a Dr. who knew what I had. I have been on Elmiron for two years now and it has changed my life!! Took about six months to feel any difference, but beleive me it's been a godsend!!!  Yes, it is expensive, but without it I would be a recluse, staying inside while the world went on around me.  Give it time to work and I think you will be surprised. No bad results for me....no hair loss, headaches or upset stomach. Elmiron has given me back my life pain free. Follow your Dr.'s orders and take it like it's been prescribed, and don't expect it to work overnight or in a couple of months, because it won't.  And if you have any problems TALK to your Dr....He is the one who has the answers you seek.  Good Luck and hopefully you will be able to go out and truly live your life to the fullest without pain!

column2: nanapam, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have just been on this drug for a week. The first few days I was so sick. My dr. says the entire lining of my bladder is affected by this disease. Does anyone know anyone that this med didn't help from this med.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: i recently found out i have intersticial cystitist & this med. has worked great for my pain...i know have no pain.

column2: NanaG, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this for 4 weeks and can tell no difference.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Nausea & Muscle aches

column2: mrs.lee, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: was on  elmiron for about 4 months before i started feeling changes.Hate the diet and the 3 times a day dosent work well with my schedule being a working mother of two. I tend to bruise alot easier my skin has become more delicate and i tend to find little cuts on my skin all the time??    not to mention..i dont heal as fast anymore, use to have clear skin, but for somereason one side of my face keeps on breaking out and the breakouts dont seem to go away??? not to forget about how costly it is  too  ;( isnt their a easier way***

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I began taking elmiron 3 times a day, but after 6 months I asked my doctor if I needed that dose.  He agreed I could cut down and see what happened.  I cut down to 2 a day for approximately 3 months and then to 1 a day 3 months later.  I have tried to stop completely, but the pain returns.  By taking just 1 dose a day I can basically eat a normal diet.  I am still extremely careful with acidic foods.  I feel very fortunate.

column2: cashback44, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: this medication worked very fast for me and i would recommend it to any one with bladder diease. It's very expensive and wish there were more medications for the treatment that are less expensive

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
red, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: The medication worked. But I lost alot of my hair.

column2: keturnerlaw, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Saw results within the first two months.  I've experienced acne on one part of my face that will not go away.  Has anyone else experienced this?  What did you do?

column2: evy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Had terrible allergic after nine days causing sore throat, ear pain, muscle aches... barely able to walk.
I have a quick question.  Has anyone experienced severe eye dryness with this medication? I am trying to figure out why my eyes are so dry and I have been on it for 8 months with another medication.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: it took several months for me to feel any results. but it has helped give me my life back. before i started taking it i could'nt get out of bed without taking tlyox or other strong pain medications due to severe lower back pain due to i.c. and endometriosis. elmoron is the first and only thing that is non narcotic that hepls controll my pain

column2: in pain, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: When I first started taking this drug it worked very well, but having been on it for over 2 years it seems like it's not working as much as before.

column2: gtrgrl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The biggest problem for me is it is so expensive! However, it is effective, but difficult to remember to take at the same time, three times per day.

column2: thertdr, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Until this was prescribed I truly felt like death could be welcomed.  It took about 3 months to start working, 21 months on it now, with mild flareups. No side effects to report.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
jadamekah, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: after taking it for 3 months it really helped but made my ibs more severe.
